text.div:
Narrativa gerada: ConceptMap ConceptMapEnvironmentalToSNOMED

Mapeamento de (não especificado) para (não especificado)


Grupo 1 Mapeamento de Lifestyle Medicine Observation Codes to SNOMED CT (all versions)

Código fonteRelacionamentoCódigo de destinoComentário
noise-avg (Environmental noise average level)narrower60156001 (Noise (physical force))Environmental noise average maps to broader SNOMED 'Noise' concept. Source is specific to average noise level over time (dB measurement), target is general noise concept. Code 60156001 should be verified.
uv-indexnarrower41355003 (Ultraviolet radiation (physical force))UV index measurement maps to broader SNOMED 'Ultraviolet radiation' concept. Source is specific UV index scale (0-11+), target is general UV radiation. Code 41355003 should be verified.
uv-duration (UV exposure duration)(not mapped)No specific SNOMED CT code for UV exposure duration as of November 2025. SNOMED has UV radiation concept but not time-based exposure measurement.
noise-duration (Environmental noise exposure duration)(not mapped)No specific SNOMED CT code for noise exposure duration as of November 2025. Occupational health codes may exist but consumer environmental monitoring is not well represented.

name: ConceptMapEnvironmentalToSNOMED
title: Environmental Exposures to SNOMED CT Mapping
description: Operational ConceptMap for environmental exposure terminology translation. Enables runtime $translate operations for semantic interoperability between environmental monitoring wearables and SNOMED CT standard terminology.
purpose: Provides semantic mappings from custom environmental exposure codes to standard SNOMED CT codes. Consumer wearables increasingly monitor environmental factors (noise, UV radiation) but lack standardized clinical terminology.

target.comment: Environmental noise average maps to broader SNOMED 'Noise' concept. Source is specific to average noise level over time (dB measurement), target is general noise concept. Code 60156001 should be verified.
UV index measurement maps to broader SNOMED 'Ultraviolet radiation' concept. Source is specific UV index scale (0-11+), target is general UV radiation. Code 41355003 should be verified.
No specific SNOMED CT code for UV exposure duration as of November 2025. SNOMED has UV radiation concept but not time-based exposure measurement.
No specific SNOMED CT code for noise exposure duration as of November 2025. Occupational health codes may exist but consumer environmental monitoring is not well represented.
